necro nocere “to hurt, harm”, necāre “to kill”, nex “murder, violent death”

𓈖 𓎡 𓈖 𓂿 | harm | noxa(na) noxia noxius “harmful” => obnoxious (knock-out)
𓈖 𓎡 𓈖 𓂿 | harm | *neḱ- “perish, disappear”;
Welsh angheu “death”, ankou, Latin nocere “to hurt, harm”, necāre “to kill”, nex “murder, violent death” (as opposed to mors), Old Persian 𐎻𐎴𐎰𐎹𐎫𐎹 (vi-n-θ-y-t-y /vi-nathayatiy/, “he injures”, Avestan 𐬥𐬀𐬯𐬌𐬌𐬈𐬌𐬙𐬌 (nasiieiti, “disappears”, 𐬥𐬀𐬯𐬎- (nasu-, “corpse”, Sanskrit नश्यति (naśyati, “disappear, perish”.
